I sold one the other day....the guy wanted a door sensor for the liquor cabinet.    Every time his teenagers opened it he gets an alert.   Here are the Coles notes,   It runs through the cable line,  and has cellular signal backup.  It checks it's connectivity and that all the sensors are connected every 60 seconds.     Most installations are free ( camera, and a few door senors). If you want to get crazy with water leaks sensors, monitored co2., ect ect, it will cost you  a few hundred for the install .   For a monitored system with cameras and live video  it's going to run you 37.50 a month.  Hope it helps.

I had Rogers to the house to do a service call and I talked to the tech about this "new" service. He was a 20 year Rogers tech, not a sub-contractor and he told me that neither he or any of the techs he knew, had the slightest idea on how to setup this system properly and make it work. He also said that at the time, Rogers was struggling to get customers signed up for the service and that he expected to be put on some kind of training soon, as customers sign up for the service. I have an analog solution to this digital service... he's 90lbs and has a mouth full of teeth! LOL HH
